str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To nod, make a sign, beckon. Apparently a primary verb; to 'nod', i.e., signal.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
